name: Jerilderie: Nolan's Ned Kelly
description:
Over the past year I've used Google Tiltbrush VR to create a homage to iconic Australian artist Sir Sidney Nolan and our cultural anti-hero Edward 'Ned' Kelly.  

The title for my project comes from Kelly's infamous (and rambling) Jerilderie Letter - https://www.nma.gov.au/explore/features/ned-kelly-jerilderie-letter

As soon as I started playing in VR I knew that I wanted to re-imagine some of Nolan's works. I started with 'Ned Kelly' (1946) as that is the one that we teachers often use to excite the pallete of young artists in primary school. As it stands, I've created 5 full pieces, which only leaves me around another 200 or so in the sequence left to go...gulp!

The Sidney Nolan Foundation have seen my work on Twitter and have liked it, so that's a good thing! If Nolan was still alive, I reckon that he'd have been an early adopter of VR.

Hope you enjoy!
Cheers, 
Jim
www.artofjimbo.com
